questions.question: What is 'Supervised Learning'?
questions.correctAnswer: Learning from labeled data (input-output pairs)

questions.question: What is 'Unsupervised Learning'?
questions.correctAnswer: Learning patterns from unlabeled data

questions.question: What is 'Overfitting'?
options: When a model learns the training data too well, capturing noise and failing to generalize
questions.correctAnswer: When a model learns the training data too well, capturing noise and failing to generalize

questions.question: What is a 'Confusion Matrix'?
options: A table used to describe the performance of a classification model
questions.correctAnswer: A table used to describe the performance of a classification model

questions.question: What is 'Pandas' library used for?
options: Data manipulation and analysis in Python
questions.correctAnswer: Data manipulation and analysis in Python

questions.question: What is 'NumPy'?
options: Fundamental package for scientific computing with Python (arrays, matrices)
questions.correctAnswer: Fundamental package for scientific computing with Python (arrays, matrices)

questions.question: What is 'Regression'?
questions.correctAnswer: Predicting a continuous value (e.g., price)

questions.question: What is 'Classification'?
options: Predicting a category/class (e.g., spam or not spam)
questions.correctAnswer: Predicting a category/class (e.g., spam or not spam)

questions.question: What is 'Feature Engineering'?
options: Process of using domain knowledge to extract features from raw data
questions.correctAnswer: Process of using domain knowledge to extract features from raw data

questions.question: What is 'Bias-Variance Tradeoff'?
options: The property of a model that the variance of the parameter estimated across samples can be reduced by increasing the bias in the estimated parameters
questions.correctAnswer: The property of a model that the variance of the parameter estimated across samples can be reduced by increasing the bias in the estimated parameters

questions.question: What is 'Cross-Validation'?
options: Resampling procedure used to evaluate machine learning models on a limited data sample
questions.correctAnswer: Resampling procedure used to evaluate machine learning models on a limited data sample

questions.question: What is 'Normal Distribution'?
options: A probability distribution that is symmetric about the mean (Bell curve)
questions.correctAnswer: A probability distribution that is symmetric about the mean (Bell curve)

questions.question: What is 'P-value'?
options: The probability of obtaining test results at least as extreme as the results actually observed, under the assumption that the null hypothesis is correct
questions.correctAnswer: The probability of obtaining test results at least as extreme as the results actually observed, under the assumption that the null hypothesis is correct

questions.question: What is 'Random Forest'?
options: An ensemble learning method for classification/regression that operates by constructing a multitude of decision trees
questions.correctAnswer: An ensemble learning method for classification/regression that operates by constructing a multitude of decision trees

questions.question: What is 'K-Means Clustering'?
options: A method of vector quantization, meant to partition n observations into k clusters
questions.correctAnswer: A method of vector quantization, meant to partition n observations into k clusters

questions.question: What is 'Deep Learning'?
options: A subset of machine learning based on artificial neural networks with representation learning
questions.correctAnswer: A subset of machine learning based on artificial neural networks with representation learning

questions.question: What is 'TensorFlow'?
options: An end-to-end open source platform for machine learning
questions.correctAnswer: An end-to-end open source platform for machine learning

questions.question: What is 'NLP'?
questions.correctAnswer: Natural Language Processing

questions.question: What is 'A/B Testing'?
questions.correctAnswer: Controlled experiment with two variants

questions.question: What is 'Gradient Descent'?
options: An iterative optimization algorithm for finding a local minimum of a differentiable function
questions.correctAnswer: An iterative optimization algorithm for finding a local minimum of a differentiable function

questions.question: What is 'One-Hot Encoding'?
options: Converting categorical data to numerical data (binary vectors)
questions.correctAnswer: Converting categorical data to numerical data (binary vectors)

questions.question: What is 'Regularization' (L1/L2)?
options: Technique used to prevent overfitting by adding a penalty term to the loss function
questions.correctAnswer: Technique used to prevent overfitting by adding a penalty term to the loss function

questions.question: What is 'Reinforcement Learning'?
options: Learning by interacting with an environment (rewards/penalties)
questions.correctAnswer: Learning by interacting with an environment (rewards/penalties)

questions.question: What is 'ROC Curve'?
options: Receiver Operating Characteristic curve (plot of TPR vs FPR)
questions.correctAnswer: Receiver Operating Characteristic curve (plot of TPR vs FPR)

questions.question: What is 'Precision'?
questions.correctAnswer: True Positives / (True Positives + False Positives)

questions.question: What is 'Recall' (Sensitivity)?
questions.correctAnswer: True Positives / (True Positives + False Negatives)

questions.question: What is 'F1 Score'?
options: Harmonic mean of Precision and Recall
questions.correctAnswer: Harmonic mean of Precision and Recall

questions.question: What is 'Ensemble Learning'?
options: Using multiple learning algorithms to obtain better predictive performance
questions.correctAnswer: Using multiple learning algorithms to obtain better predictive performance

questions.question: What is 'PCA'?
questions.correctAnswer: Principal Component Analysis (Dimensionality reduction)

questions.question: What is 'Bagging'?
questions.correctAnswer: Bootstrap Aggregating (e.g., Random Forest)

questions.question: What is 'Boosting'?
options: Ensemble technique that converts weak learners to strong ones (e.g., XGBoost)
questions.correctAnswer: Ensemble technique that converts weak learners to strong ones (e.g., XGBoost)

questions.question: What is 'Vanishing Gradient Problem'?
options: Gradients become vanishingly small preventing weight updates in deep networks
questions.correctAnswer: Gradients become vanishingly small preventing weight updates in deep networks

questions.question: What is 'LSTM'?
questions.correctAnswer: Long Short-Term Memory (RNN architecture)

questions.question: What is 'CNN'?
questions.correctAnswer: Convolutional Neural Network (Image processing)

questions.question: What is 'Transfer Learning'?
options: Storing knowledge gained while solving one problem and applying it to a different but related problem
questions.correctAnswer: Storing knowledge gained while solving one problem and applying it to a different but related problem

questions.question: What is 'Imbalanced Dataset'?
options: When the classes are not represented equally
questions.correctAnswer: When the classes are not represented equally

questions.question: What is 'SMOTE'?
questions.correctAnswer: Synthetic Minority Over-sampling Technique

questions.question: What is 'Exploratory Data Analysis' (EDA)?
options: Analyzing data sets to summarize their main characteristics, often with visual methods
questions.correctAnswer: Analyzing data sets to summarize their main characteristics, often with visual methods

questions.question: What is 'Feature Scaling'?
options: Normalizing the range of independent variables or features of data
questions.correctAnswer: Normalizing the range of independent variables or features of data

questions.question: What is 'Hyperparameter Tuning'?
options: Choosing a set of optimal hyperparameters for a learning algorithm
questions.correctAnswer: Choosing a set of optimal hyperparameters for a learning algorithm

questions.question: What is 'TimeSeries Analysis'?
options: Methods for analyzing time series data in order to extract meaningful statistics
questions.correctAnswer: Methods for analyzing time series data in order to extract meaningful statistics

questions.question: What is 'ARIMA'?
options: AutoRegressive Integrated Moving Average (Time series model)
questions.correctAnswer: AutoRegressive Integrated Moving Average (Time series model)

questions.question: What is 'Null Hypothesis'?
options: The hypothesis that there is no significant difference between specified populations
questions.correctAnswer: The hypothesis that there is no significant difference between specified populations

questions.question: What is 'Type I Error'?
options: False Positive (Rejecting a true null hypothesis)
questions.correctAnswer: False Positive (Rejecting a true null hypothesis)

questions.question: What is 'Type II Error'?
options: False Negative (Failing to reject a false null hypothesis)
questions.correctAnswer: False Negative (Failing to reject a false null hypothesis)

questions.question: What is 'Bias' in ML?
options: Simplified assumptions made by a model to make the target function easier to learn
questions.correctAnswer: Simplified assumptions made by a model to make the target function easier to learn

questions.question: What is 'Variance' in ML?
options: The amount that the estimate of the target function will change if different training data was used
questions.correctAnswer: The amount that the estimate of the target function will change if different training data was used

questions.question: What is 'Activation Function'?
options: Function that defines the output of that node given an input or set of inputs (e.g., ReLU, Sigmoid)
questions.correctAnswer: Function that defines the output of that node given an input or set of inputs (e.g., ReLU, Sigmoid)

questions.question: What is 'Dropout'?
options: Regularization technique where randomly selected neurons are ignored during training
questions.correctAnswer: Regularization technique where randomly selected neurons are ignored during training

questions.question: What is 'Tokenization'?
options: Breaking a stream of text up into words, phrases, symbols, or other meaningful elements
questions.correctAnswer: Breaking a stream of text up into words, phrases, symbols, or other meaningful elements
